content:
Here are the adapted sigmoid-like transformed values for the adjectives and things, using the transformed scores from 0.0 to 1.0:

0.0000: Terrible - Spoiled food that is dangerous to eat
0.0250: Awful - A very rude and unhelpful customer service representative
0.1000: Poor - A poorly written book with numerous grammatical errors and a weak plot
0.2250: Mediocre - A disappointing movie that has a few redeeming qualities, such as a strong performance from a supporting actor
0.4000: Below average - A meal at a restaurant that is mediocre and not worth the price
0.5000: Average - An average day at work, where nothing particularly good or bad happens
0.6000: Decent - A helpful tutorial that covers the basics of a topic but lacks depth
0.7750: Good - A well-designed app that occasionally has minor bugs or usability issues
0.9000: Great - A beautiful and engaging piece of art that resonates with many people
0.9750: Excellent - An excellent and inspiring TED talk that leaves a lasting impact on the audience
1.0000: Outstanding - A life-changing event, such as the birth of a child or achieving a lifelong dream

These examples now have sigmoid-like transformed values that provide a more intuitive mapping to the desired range of 0.0 to 1.0.
